pages.text: Despite the differences, $(thing)Alchemical Artisanship$() shares a basic fundamental with $(thing)Alchemy$(): the use of a $(item)Calcinator$().$(br2)A $(item)Calcinator$() is a structure with the simple purpose of breaking down materials into raw, impure $(item)Ash$(). At the core of one lies a standard $(item)Cauldron$(), stoked by fire surrounded by stone material.

pages.name: Calcinator
pages.text: (note, the $(item)Stone Bricks$() may be replaced with any other stone material block)

Using the $(item)Calcinator$() is a fairly simple process:$(br)$(li)As a requirement, the fire must stay lit. If it fizzles, it can be reignited without any loss.$(li)First off, toss the item you wish to burn inside of the cauldron, then proceed to wait a few seconds.$(li)After a while, the resulting item will pop off and land in an adjacent block.
